title: Thunderbird is crashing every time I try to add a hyperlink
content: Thunderbird (Windows, 115.3.2) is crashing every time I try to add a hyperlink. The message that I'm working on freezes and I cannot close it except using the Task Manager. I would like to simply install the previous version, but I can't seem to find that. I have tried re-installing 115.3.2 to no effect.
creator: rtwoodward

title: Bulk modification to view columns for RSS feed folders
content:
I have a preferred set of columns that I would like to apply to all my RSS feeds in Thunderbird 115.

In theory, the GUI provides a way of doing this ("Apply all columns to..."). However, this doesn't seem to work for RSS feed folders in the same way as mail folders, and no one has identified a way to make it work (see previous question: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1425573).

What's the best alternative way of doing this in bulk? I can see that the .msf files for the folders contain data like the below:

(DC=12)(DD=$121)(DE ={"selectCol":{"visible":true,"ordinal":"1"},"threadCol":{"visible":false,\ "ordinal":"3"},"attachmentCol":{"visible":true,"ordinal":"5"},"senderCol":{"vi\ sible":true,"ordinal":"7"},"subjectCol":{"visible":true,"ordinal":"9"},"unread\ ButtonColHeader":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"11"},"statusCol":{"visible":false\ ,"ordinal":"13"},"deleteCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"15"},"sizeCol":{"visi\ ble":false,"ordinal":"17"},"flaggedCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"19"},"acco\ untCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"21"},"priorityCol":{"visible":false,"ordin\ al":"23"},"unreadCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"25"},"totalCol":{"visible":f\ alse,"ordinal":"27"},"idCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"29"},"recipientCol":{\ "visible":false,"ordinal":"31"},"junkStatusCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"33\ "},"tagsCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"35"},"correspondentCol":{"visible":fa\ lse,"ordinal":"37"},"receivedCol":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"39"},"locationCo\ l":{"visible":false,"ordinal":"41"},"dateCol":{"visible":true,"ordinal":"43"}})

That seems to be what I'm looking for, but I'm reluctant to make a direct edit since the overall format of the file isn't clear.

Is there a better way to make the change in bulk?
creator: pg_78

title: Duplicate Drafts folders

There are messages in both. How do I fix this without losing things.

title: supernova: divider bar in Classic View is worse wrt to new messages
content:
In Classic View of prior version of Thunderbird, I could set the divider btw email headers and the message pane just below the latest msg, and new mail would show above the divider. That way we could see the Subject and Sender of the new arrival.

in 115 the behavior for moving the divider is different (and not as good). Moving the divider brings down more message headers from the top - it's impossible to have a partially blank space [where new mail would go] below the last message.

Please restore the old behavior for this small detail in your next release!
creator: mspiegel

title: Spam getting moved back to inbox - what's happening?
content:
Thunderbird seems to recognise spam pretty well, but every 20 or so spam mails will for some inexplicable reason be moved back to the inbox.

It IS marked as spam by thunderbird, and the option to return it to the "spam"-folder implies that it has been correctly placed initially. (See picture)

What's going on?

title: Rotating Color Ball Always Showing Up.  Program Is Essentially Unusable.  Help, PLEASE
content:
Hello,

Help, please. Sr. Citizen now, and this is driving me crazy. Using on a Mac, Thunderbird vers.115.3.2. 64 Bit

Don't know if it updated to this vers, automatically, or if I may have asked for the update.

Anyway, used to be rock solid. Worked flawlessly.

Now, all that happens is that rotating colorful ball. Continuously. Or, maybe, goes away after 10 minutes or so. Maybe. Then, it (usually) does show latest eMails.

Essentially unusable due to that rotating ball that always shows up irrespective of whatever you want to do.

What is wrong, please ?

I Un-clicked "Enable Global Search and Indexer" and also Un-Clicked "Use Hardware Acceleration When Available"

What should I do ? Can I revert to an older revision that actually works ?

I'm probably, as usual, missing something basic, but I can't imagine what.

Would be most grateful for any thoughts, or suggestions.

Much thanks, Bob

title: Issue with Email Sending after Update to Version 115 (Custom SMTP port and STARTTLS)
content:
Hello everyone,

I would like to report an issue I have encountered after updating to Thunderbird version 115. Prior to the update to this version, I had no problems with sending emails. However, after updating to version 115, I have observed the following error:

Error Description: When configuring the SMTP server connection with STARTTLS enabled and a custom port (2500), email sending fails. The issue does not occur if I disable STARTTLS or use the standard port 25 (with STARTTLS).


Current Behavior: Email sending fails with Error message attached


SMTP Log of Thunderbird: mailnews.smtp: Sending message <122d4dfb-e197-48f4-b81b-f262e5b97537@example.com> SmtpService.jsm:88:18 mailnews.smtp: Connecting to smtp://email.example.com:2500 SmtpClient.jsm:123:19 mailnews.smtp: Connected SmtpClient.jsm:395:17 mailnews.smtp: S: 220 mail.example.com - Restricted SMTP server is waiting for your HELO/EHLO

SmtpClient.jsm:418:17 mailnews.smtp: C: EHLO [192.168.15.224] SmtpClient.jsm:622:19 mailnews.smtp: S: 250-mail.example.com

250-PIPELINING

250-SIZE 48720000

250-ETRN

250-STARTTLS

250-AUTH PLAIN LOGIN

250-ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES

250-8BITMIME

250-DSN

250 CHUNKING

SmtpClient.jsm:418:17 mailnews.smtp: C: STARTTLS SmtpClient.jsm:622:19

mailnews.smtp: S: 220 2.0.0 Ready to start TLS

SmtpClient.jsm:418:17 mailnews.smtp: C: EHLO [192.168.15.224] SmtpClient.jsm:622:19 mailnews.smtp: SecurityError: a SecurityProtocol error occurred SmtpClient.jsm:442:17 mailnews.smtp: Socket closed. SmtpClient.jsm:518:17 mailnews.smtp: SecurityError info: SSL_ERROR_HANDSHAKE_FAILED SmtpClient.jsm:458:21 mailnews.send: Sending failed; The message could not be sent using Outgoing server (SMTP) email.example.com for an unknown reason. Please verify that your Outgoing server (SMTP) settings are correct and try again., exitCode=2153394004, originalMsgURI= MessageSend.jsm:337:32 sizeToContent() is deprecated and will be removed in the future. commonDialog.js:120:9

Environment: We have a number of installations across Europe, and this issue seems to be specific to few offices only (for now). Other installations are functioning correctly even with the new version.


I tried to solve it with internet providers, but according to their emails they don't block aything ...

Thank you for your assistance in addressing this issue!
creator: martin.korf

title: Firma con immagini, testo evidenziato con colori e link di collegamento
content: Salve, sono nuova su Thunderbird. Ho appena migrato la posta da Outlook a T. e sto cercando di impostare i vari parametri, tra cui la firma che dovrà essere presente in tutte le mail. Come potete vedere dall'immagine allegata, la firma contiene l'immagine col nome della ditta dove lavoro, testo evidenziato e link di collegamento per download di file. Mi chiedevo come impostare questa firma, visto che posso solo gestire o semplice testo o html nelle impostazioni dell'account. Ho provato vari siti per tradurre questa cosa, ma sembra impossibile e quindi al momento non mi resta che fare il copia/incolla su tutte le mail a mano. C'è un modo automatico per impostare questa firma? Grazie. Sara Bisaro

title: Time of download shown in receive column rather than time of email receipt on server
content: I have an overnight email sent from one of my programs which, when sent via gmail smtp, showed the correct time/date received. Spamhaus didn't like this and I was flagged. Now, I have switched the smtp to my own domain, it shows the time I opened the email in thunderbird rather that the time the server received it. Looking at my email account via the web access, the received time is correct. By way of a test, I have Postbox on my pc and I added my account to that. It did the same thing, showing the time that Postbox viewed it, rather than server receipt time. I have searched on the web and, although I can find time zone issues, I find nothing like this. Can anyone suggest any areas of investigation I should be looking at? Many thanks.
creator: gordon47

title: Al clic si apre una mail diversa
content: Mi è successo ora un paio di volte che non riesco più ad accedere ad alcuni singoli messaggi, sia nella posta inviata, sia nella posta in arrivo. Faccio clic su un messaggio e invece me ne apre uno totalmente diverso, con un altro interlocutore. Provo a cliccare su quell'altro messaggio, ma in quel caso funziona correttamente e mi mostra effettivamente il messaggio a cui fa riferimento nella lista. Mi è successo con messaggi provenienti da interlocutori diversi. Se invece entro con il browser nel sito del fornitore della posta elettronica il messaggio che cerco è presente e corretto.
creator: marco.baumer

title: Egress control issues with Thunderbird ( TCP session reuse issue ? )
content:
I control all egress traffic from my installations and that includes Thunderbird, however Thunderbird is not behaving nicely, a lot of cases the sessions are made based on IP rather then based on DNS hence making good egress rules for it is rather cumbersome, my suspicion that the TCP sessions are not reused by TB when opening the IMAP or SMTP, or HTTPS sessions hence the egress control software does not see that this session is linked to the query made to resolve to this IP.

Env: 

- Littlesnitch - Thundebird - Linux
creator: firefox2545

title: Versione 115.3.2
content: Buongiorno, da qualche giorno mi si è auto installata la versione Thunderbird 115.3.2. Una vera e propria delusione dal punto di vista grafico!! L'elenco delle email tutto attaccato, mentre nelle versioni precedenti c'erano almeno 3/4 mm tra una riga ed un'altra e questo da veramente fastidio a vedersi. Inoltre, la cosa più "grave" che sempre nelle versioni precedenti quando andavi su un account l'ultima mail arrivata appariva subito (in alto o in basso dipendeva da come impostata la visone) e quindi di facile consultazione. Mentre ora esce a metà circa, ad esempio prendendo in considerazione la data di oggi 18.10, l'elenco delle mail di un qualsiasi account non visiona questa data ma quella di almeno un mese prima e quindi bisogna andare col mouse nella freccetta e arrivare alla data attuale. Ripeto una grossa grossissima delusione per me che ho Thunderbird da oltre 20 anni. Si spera che si possa risolvere in qualche modo questi due "problemi" altrimenti sarò costretto a cambiare gestore di posta elettronica. Ringrazio anticipatamente per la eventuale cortese risposta e porgo cordiali saluti.
creator: zulli.danilo

title: Oauth2 for smtp.office365.com not working
content:
I'm using Thunderbird with an office365.com account. Receive works fine. Sending always fails with: 

   Login to account "smtp.office365.com" failed 
   Login to server smtp.office365.com with username NAME@DOMAIN.COM failed. 
   [Enter New Password]              [Cancel]  [Retry]

Pressing the [Enter New Password] button makes the dialogue go away, but it doesn't prompt for a password. The OAuth2 authorisation screen I expected to appear never appears.

SMTP server config is: 

   Description: 	NAME@DOMAIN.COM    Server Name: 	smtp.office365.com    Port: 	587    User Name: 	NAME@DOMAIN.COM    Authentication method: 	OAuth2    Connection Security: 	STARTTLS

The only other thing I can think of is the org uses SSO (saml2). SMTP is turn on at the Microsoft send, and we have tried Vincent's suggestion: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1307784#answer-1376341

Thunderbird, 115.3.2, Build ID 20231010142850. Running on macOS Sonoma Version 14.0
creator: russell+accounts.firefox.com

creator: berand

title: Error with overlapping filters
content:
I have a set of filters that each end with a "stop filter execution" as the last action, and a final filter that applies to anything from a "no-reply" style sender address. The intent is that a message will match at most one of these filters, as any of the early filters prevents a later filter from running on the same message.

The problem is, for some reason, messages that could be caught by multiple of these early filters, are caught by all of them, even after the filter execution was supposedly stopped at the first matching filter. As a result, the last filter is taking precedence, not the first.

Below are the relevant lines of the filter log, for one specific message that I'm having this issue with, after pressing the "run filter" button once:

[2023-10-18, 11:11:03] Applied filter "The Overflow" to message from Stack Overflow <do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email> - The Overflow #199: Code every Zig at 2023-10-11, 10:00:22 moved message id = 0d-9jWWxRdCOs_OqBhPe2A@geopod-ismtpd-33 to imap://my_email_account/Notifications/The Overflow [2023-10-18, 11:11:11] Applied filter "NoReply" to message from Stack Overflow <do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email> - The Overflow #199: Code every Zig at 2023-10-11, 10:00:22 moved message id = 0d-9jWWxRdCOs_OqBhPe2A@geopod-ismtpd-33 to imap://my_email_account/Notifications [2023-10-18, 11:11:17] Applied filter "NoReply" to message from Stack Overflow <do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email> - The Overflow #199: Code every Zig at 2023-10-11, 10:00:22 moved message id = 0d-9jWWxRdCOs_OqBhPe2A@geopod-ismtpd-33 to imap://my_email_account/Notifications

And the filters in question (edited to remove my email account): version="9" logging="yes" name="The Overflow" enabled="yes" type="17" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://my_email_account/Notifications/The Overflow" action="Stop execution" condition="AND (from,is,do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email) AND (subject,contains,The Overflow)" name="NoReply" enabled="yes" type="48" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://my_email_account/Notifications" condition="OR (from,contains,noreply) OR (from,contains,no-reply) OR (from,contains,no_reply) OR (from,contains,no reply) OR (from,contains,no.reply) OR (from,contains,donotreply) OR (from,contains,do-not-reply) OR (from,contains,do_not_reply) OR (from,contains,do not reply) OR (from,contains,do.not.reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,noreply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no-reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no_reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no.reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,donotreply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do-not-reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do_not_reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do not reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do.not.reply)"


The solution would seem to be to reverse the order of the filters, to take advantage of the fact that the later filter takes precedence, but for some reason that doesn't work either. With the filters in reverse order, only the first filter is running.

Here's the relevant log line (just the one this time) after reordering the filters: [2023-10-18, 11:51:13] Applied filter "NoReply" to message from Stack Overflow <do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email> - The Overflow #199: Code every Zig at 2023-10-11, 10:00:22 moved message id = 0d-9jWWxRdCOs_OqBhPe2A@geopod-ismtpd-33 to imap://zoeyhewll%40gmail.com@imap.gmail.com/Notifications


And here's the filters:

version="9" logging="yes" name="NoReply" enabled="yes" type="48" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://my_email_account/Notifications" condition="OR (from,contains,noreply) OR (from,contains,no-reply) OR (from,contains,no_reply) OR (from,contains,no reply) OR (from,contains,no.reply) OR (from,contains,donotreply) OR (from,contains,do-not-reply) OR (from,contains,do_not_reply) OR (from,contains,do not reply) OR (from,contains,do.not.reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,noreply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no-reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no_reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,no.reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,donotreply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do-not-reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do_not_reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do not reply) OR (\"reply-to\",contains,do.not.reply)" name="The Overflow" enabled="yes" type="17" action="Move to folder" actionValue="imap://my_email_account/Notifications/The Overflow" action="Stop execution" condition="AND (from,is,do-not-reply@stackoverflow.email) AND (subject,contains,The Overflow)"


My guess is that this has something to do with the fact that I see the status line "Downloading message X of Y in The Overflow..." every time the message is successfully filtered, followed by those messages moving back to notifications folder, with the message "Downloading message X of Y in Notifications...". I suspect that this is re-triggering some of the filters.
creator: CandyCorvid
